review: This antibiotic has left me really unwell, I was prescribed 200mg 2x daily for 3 days, I only took 3 tablets ( 1 a day)..firstly felt like my kidneys had been battered, followed by severe stomach pain, extreme shivers and anxiety, also bad insomnia !! Getting sharp shooting pains ( like an electric shock all through my body !! Bad muscle aches as well.. warning !! If you suffer mental illness please avoid, as these pills really heighten everything.  No more for me, it is an awful drugs. Not forgetting head aches, facial pain and horrendous nausea. I feel for all the patients experiencing these unwanted side effects, it's been 1 and a 1/2 days since stopping them, praying this will all pass real soon. In my opinion, they should be taken off the market pronto hope doctors realise what toxicity they cause. I never will I take these again, not worth the suffering.

Was prescribed 2 tablets per day over 3 days...let's just say I would rather have put up with the UTI. These tablets need banning. I'm currently on my third day in bed with the worse migraine, body shakes, itchy skin, loose Bowel movement and intense thirst. At night my mind is racing with thoughts (like a slideshow flicking at speed). I would never take these tablets again.

Was prescribed 200mg twice a day for uti & possible kidney infection for 5 days. Not even an hour after the 1st pill hit my system I was throwing up, shaking, agitated, having horrific thoughts, anxiety,  couldn't stand and had such bad fatigue I could hardly lift my head off the pillow. Also had facial bone pain along my jaw and cheekbones. After my 3rd day (today 4th March 22) my doctor advised to stop & switch to a different antibiotic as I am just not coping on these. I'd rather sit in the bath for hours on end drinking cranberry juice and water to flush out the uti than ever take these again!
Awful. My legs turned to jelly and I felt worse than having the UTI itself. Awful drug

I was prescribed 100 mg of Trimethoprim before bed for 6 months in hopes that it would help with my recurrent UTIs. It took a single dose to realize that this type of antibiotics wasn’t for me. I broke out in hives with a swollen face the next morning. I had never had an allergic reaction to drugs before. My arms and legs are extremely itchy. The only plus side is that despite having a sensitive stomach, it didn’t make me nauseous nor did it give me bad stomach cramps.

Had a water infection. 7 days of trimethoprim 200 mg prescribed by my G.P at one tablet twice daily. My infection did go but I felt so nauseous and spaced out after day 2 of taking them. Day 6 I nearly stopped as I felt anxious for no reason and wanted to eat but the nausea made it difficult ! Horrid side effects for me …….
Now three days into treatment and still in pain, feel sick, have headaches and severe bowel cramps.

Prescribed a three day course (one twice a day) for UTI over the phone. First day gave me a raging head and dizziness. The second day (Xmas eve) I felt nauseous all day. Decided to take my second dose with food. An hour later I started vomiting and violently shaking. This lasted a few hours when it seemed to subside (I'm 2 weeks post COVID so it's easy to blame COVID for everything, but this felt different). Xmas day morning the vomiting returned along with the violent shaking - no fever. Also, mind full of paranoid thoughts. I have never been so scared in my life. Rang 111, the doctor said it was a reaction to the trimethoprim and to stop taking them (I had). Prescribed anti-sickness tablets and advised to call back if symptoms worsened. Thankfully by boxing day I had recovered. I just can't believe these side effects aren't made common knowledge.

Horrific.Woke up from a nap on the first day of taking with suicide ideas. Staying in an apartment and had balcony visions. Suffer with PTSD but not suicidal.  Currently on holiday so panic disorder has set in but has been massively exemplified by this antibiotic. Was prescribed 5 day dose stopped taking after day 3. Still feeling side effects and wondering if I’ll return to normal or whether this is it now.

Got 200mg to be taken twice daily for a UTI.  Night one I started to vomit and zero energy with an indescribable migraine, I put it down to the UTI making me poorly. Over the next few days I started my muscles to cramp up massively my arms and legs would not move and the energy to move them was too much. It also caused unbelievable acid reflux, could not eat for a week literally zero appetite. Lost a lot of weight. The last two days the anxiety insomnia and panic attacks set in. This is when I checked on here for reviews and realised I wasn't the only one.It cleared the infection, but boy, what I put down over the week was something else, please find an alternative if you can.

I start of by telling you shouldn't read reviews. This is my second antibiotic for UTI. I was terrified of taking the two antibiotics as I  had suffered a panic attacks on day 3 of trimethoprim, no side effects of yet so don't read reviews everyone is different.

Prescribed Trimethoprim for UTI one a day for 2 weeks.  It has set off my migraines and I had to stay in bed for 2 days.  I can’t eat feel like I’ve been punched in the stomach, nausea 24/7 rash all over body plus itching worst experience of antibiotic ever !!!!!!
I have suffered from recurrent UTI's for over 40 years. I've taken every antibiotic going. This is the only one that clears it with no side effects. In fact even after 2 tablets I am on the mend.

I was put on Trimethoprim 200 mg tablets twice a day. After the 1st day I did get a racing heart but that stopped after the 2nd day but after that I experience feeling really really low, depressed, not wanting to leave the house and when I did I felt very shaky and nervous. I have never felt like this before in my life and I have never experienced this after taking any other antibiotic. I told the pharmacist about the symptoms/side effects and she told me to notify my doctor/GP, which I did, and she said that when I complete the course (I was on day 6 of a 7 day course) that after a few days I should feel better. She said she won't prescibe this particular antibiotic to me in the future.

At first I took a couple of Amoxcillin  and my symptoms had nearly gone by the time I had my appointment. My doc for some reason prescribed me this. Took my first dose last night for UTI. Got up and nearly fell into the wall I was so dizzy. Couldn’t sleep at all last night until about 10 hours after taking the pill. Experienced anxiety, however I do suffer from anxiety but it’s medicated and generally ok. Still a little dizzy this morning and my UTI symptoms have started to come back :( Going back to get more amoxicillin!

I was prescribed a 7 day course of this antibiotic, as the 3 day course of Nitrofurantoin did not work but I think they would have done the job if the course was for 7 days as I never had any of the symptoms I have with Trimethoprim. All the symptoms I had along with the UTI were awful exactly as others have described ie couldn’t sleep, felt very sick, was sick as just had no appetite for 5 days whilst in them. These tablets should make you feel better not suicidal. Had a terrible headache and felt weird and anxiety thoughts went through the roof ended up in A&E on the second day. I have taken 5 1/2 days worth and now binned the others and will take may chances. I will also let my doctor know.
I am amazed at all these negative reviews with their dramatic side effects . My experience is that it fixed my UTI ( a bad one , heaps of blood in urine) with no noticeable  side effects at all.

Given nitrofurantoin at hospital. Bad reaction A&E gave me Trimethoprim 200mg twice day for 3 days. Fine first day and thought I was cured just felt bit sick but today no energy, very  very nauseous and palpitations and headache. Don't really want to take this for another day. If I could actually speak to my GP it would be a miracle! Don't want to end back in A&E

My GP gave me 3 tablets of Trimethoprim Mylan . I wish I had never taken them the side effects are not worth it !! The headache was so bad it just didn’t go away unable to do anything, constant nausea and chills and shaking . I cannot believe they can market this drug without extreme warnings . There was no pamphlet inside to notify of side effects.I am deeply upset about this and I won’t ever touch it again.I am not exaggerating Thank you

Dreadful! These were so bad my kidneys and bladder. Couldn’t urinate, weakness, dripping with sweat, couldn’t think or speak, trembling and breathless. I felt like I’d been thumped in the kidneys. I believe this is due to the fact that they increase potassium levels !

Prescribed 1 Trimethoprim at night for a long-term UTI and all it has done is made the UTI symptoms worse.I'm fine in the day but at night I can't sleep because of the burning /tingling sensation in my girly bits, the pain is indescribable, I'm seeing my GP today so I'll get them changed.Worst antibiotic I've ever had.

I had an uncomplicated UTI and was prescribed a 6 day course of TMP.  After the first tablet I developed intense nausea, chills and overwhelming fatigue.  I have now taken 3 tablets and have not eaten in three days.  Even the sight of food makes me sick.  I pretty much lay on my electric blanket with alternating chills and sweating.  I am terminating usage and will never accept this drug again.  I think that it did knock out the UTI.

I got these on the 19th of July at a dose of 200mg twice a day for 7 days.  The 1st day I got a headache, 2nd day no headache but felt a bit sickly, 3rd day started to feel normal, 4th day I feel good.  I'm taking ibuprofen as well to stop the inflammation and fever.  I do feel better as when I pee it doesn’t burn and I can have a cuppa and not run to the bog every minute, I finish the course on Sunday the 25th of July 2021, I can’t wait as I’m wanting a beer lol. But I never got anxiety or anything like that.

I have just completed 7 days of trimethoprim.I do suffer from some anxiety but when I took these my anxiety was really really awful and feel really low.This is my second time having UTI in six months.But now I am scared of getting UTI back because of tablet. They tried one before trimethoprim but that made me feel very sick.I was exhausted, couldn’t concentrate, just so so anxious.I really don't like antibiotics and I know they save lives but I always have a reaction mentally when I need them.

Was given a 3 day course 200mg tablets for a bladder infection and I was dubious in taking them and now I know why.  I took my first one yesterday evening  and my side effect symptoms began with itchy skin, blurred vision and the start of a headache. I went to bed early because I felt weak then kept waking in the night and each time my mouth was extremely dry. I woke with a bad headache today and will not be taking anymore of that antibiotic. I think we are all just lab rats

Day 3 and this drug has made absolutely no difference at all. I recall this exact same thing happening last time I had a UTI (a while ago now) and I was changed to a different antibiotic. My experience has not been a good one at all.
I have always found almost immediate relief in my symptoms with this drug and zero side effects. I’m extremely thankful that it works for me, it’s been a life saver.

Got prescribed a 7 day course of Trimethoprim 200mg twice daily after symptoms returned after course of Nitrofurantoin. Started it in the evening after a meal and immediately felt very tired (figured could be UTI)Continued with course till day 3, getting progressively more tired, could not stay awake. Felt very weak and shaky and had a stiff neck. Had nausea but continued to eat. When I was awake I had a sense of anxiety, clenching fists, raised shoulders up to neck, palpitations, clenched jaw. Not usually something I struggle with. General feeling of being very unwell. Strange sharp aches and pains randomly on my body, abdomen and back, inner thighs etc.  Very thirsty as well, waking to drink but not to pee. Decided to stop the antibiotic and felt better the next day, 24 hours after last med was taken. Would never touch this again.

GP put me on Trimethoprim 300 twice daily for UTI caused by enlarged prostate and a huge bladder stone. Had the first dose on the day one. Day two took second dose, symptoms seemed to be elevating, by the third dose started to feel strange in my thoughts, I knew something wasn't right but didn't think of antibiotic. Started getting dizzy like car sickness, trembling everywhere in my body then suddenly threw up anywhere and everywhere, caused many physical symptoms as well as anxiety, depression, dissasociation and suicidal thoughts. Long story short attempted suicide, police were called, been admitted to hospital three times for physical and mental assessment. Please accept my best wishes if you have used this medicine with adverse effects, I wish you a speedy recovery.

This medication was prescribed to me by a sexual health clinic for a severe UTI. It was completely ineffective and I needed up at a different doctor 40 hours later with not only my down there burning and inflamed but now severe pain in my back which I can only infer was due to my kidneys now also becoming infected. You want to know what that feels like, get into a resting state and ask someone to smash hammer into your mid back just below the waist on either side of the spine as hard as they can. It was so bad I was put on a higher dose of a more common antibiotic and prescribed to get an ultrasound.

Took this antibiotic for 4 days once a day. It got rid of the UTI but within a week of finishing I broke out in a rash on my legs and arms and in my hair that I thought was eczema. Plus I got a spasm and pain  in my left kidney area and low back out so I thought the infection had not been cleared so I went back to the dr and he prescribed it again. I took one tablet and broke out in a worse rash all over my body. It’s everywhere. Hot ugly and I can’t stop scratching.it’s driving me crazy.  How am I going to get rid of it? Another drug? Worse drug I’ve ever taken. Never again.

Presented to Doctors for UTI. Was prescribed trimethoprim for 5 days. 300mg, one per day.I have never had such a horrible reaction to an antibiotic. I did think it was odd that the dose was so low and only 1 per day, and now I know why. Any higher and I probably would have been hospitalised! I had the worst, worst stomach cramps, nausea, wobbly legs, zero energy, couldn’t sleep at night, sweating on and off, horrible jaw clenching, tense body muscles (especially in the back of my neck) and very, very anxious. It’s easy to second guess yourself and think that these side affects are just in conjunction with the UTI but me, personally, know my body very, very well and these tablets just made me so sick and in my opinion the UTI was easier than taking these.  Now that I’m 2 days off these pills I am creeping back to normality. My advice is don’t take them unless you want to risk the side affects.

UTI ... so I was given trimethoprim, two a day,  seven days. Things seemed fine until 7th day. Rash broke out all over my body. Felt like I had a fever, though I had normal temperature. But when I tried to sleep .... ! Sweating, constant shifting position, none of which were comfortable for more than 10 seconds. My mind seemed to be racing away on its own, and I had no idea why I was running over and over in my head all this stuff that was absolutely nothing to do with me. But every time I even tried to nap or doze, away went my mind at breakneck speed on weird subjects. For two nights I simply did not sleep at all, had to sit on the sofa just waiting for morning. It was very scary. Never again would I take this.

This is my second course of Trimethoprim for the same urinary infection. Didn't work after 1 week and now the GP has put me on 2 weeks.  Still uncomfortable and not at all confident it's resolving the issue, just masking the symptoms a bit.
I have been prescribed a 7 day course of trimethoprim for a UTI and have had a non stop headache, dizzy spells, weakness in my knees and extreme thirst after only 2 doses.
I have found trimethoprim to be excellent at clearing up my UTI
It caused me severe diarrhoea after just one dose.

I took trimethoprim for 4 days before switching to a better antibiotic as trimethoprim didn't clear my UTI. While on it I would wake up during the nights with terrible anxiety and couldn't get back to sleep. As soon as I switched to another medication the sleeping/anxiety issues disappeared.

This trimethoprim medication is dreadful, the side effects seem to hang on well after finishing the course. I’ve used this medication a few times, and thought it was only me with side effects.I have a thyroid disorder and this medication has absolutely  sent my blood reading all over the place ... which results in my thyroid medication being lowered each time ..Terrible insomnia, my body ached all over, and itchy...these side effects still linger, two months later ...it’s literally destroyed my gut and wrecked my insides ..all I’m doing now is working on trying to rectify this ..

First of all I have had a stressful time recently but was coming out of it. Suspected UTI so GP prescribed 7 days worth of Trimethoprim. After 2 doses the panic started. Thought nothing of it. Day 2 by the evening I thought I had flu. Body aches, headache, hot flashes alternating with shivering then every pulse in my body was thumping as well as my heart so that then lead to a panic attack as my pulse was going way too fast. I feel awful today. General weakness and body aches and my head is thumping. I actually feel like stopping these tonight after 3 days as I feel awful, anxious and tonight depressed and hopeless. Yes the burning when peeing has stopped but now I'm peeing loads because of the anxiety and panic. Honestly can't 100% say Trimethoprim has caused all of it but I'm pretty sure it's caused a lot of it. Just putting this here in case anyone else is suffering the same you aren't alone. I see others have suffered similar.

I got this antibitic trimethoprim and have been taking it for two days, but have stopped taking it now. I thought I was seriously ill till reading these reviews. The side effects symptoms it caused was constant nausea, blinding headaches, flashes all wrapped up in excessive anxiety. NEVER AGAIN!!

Started trimethoprim course for UTI 4 hours later wanting to rip my skin off the itching unbearable kept me awake all night. 2nd night same thing been awake scratching the hives my skin is sore red and angry allergic reaction? I am not too happy myself. But just want to get rid of the uti.

I went into emergency for lower back pain last week, told me I had UTI.  The hospital prescribed me trimethoprim for 3 day but my GP increased it to 7 days. I'm on my 5th day (I stopped) and it has been HORRIBLE. The sided effects from trimethoprim are nausea, body aches, diarrhea, runny nose, high anxiety EVERYTHING that has been described on this thread. I thought it was just me until I found this forum.  I will be seeing my GP tomorrow. I can't deal with these sides effects. Never again am I touching these antibiotics ...

I've taken Alprim previously in a small course, but was put on a 7 day course and it has taken the life out of me, I don't want to eat, the thought of it makes my stomach turn, feel like vomiting every second, tired, sweating, anxiety.

On this trimethoprim medication for 3 days for UTI and  OMG the side effects are horrendous. How can they give out medication to people that is suppose to make you well but ends up a total nightmare. I couldn't sleep due to burning up and feeling really nauseous all night. No appetite, feeling weak, dry mouth, headache, anxiety, painful back. Have stopped taking them as there are a lot better medications out there. I think doctors should really read up about some of the stuff they hand out so easily to people. Hoping these horrible feelings pass soon.

First 7 days of taking Trimethoprim made me feel ill, nauseous, vomiting, shaking, sweats, headache felt better once course ended but 2 weeks later UTI back further 7 days prescribed this time raging temperature, vomiting, mouth sore, throat sore, runny nose and breathless shaking clammy skin rash.  Urine test showed clear of UTI told by GP immediately stop taking Trimethoprim 24 hours later still feeling ill with intermittent above side effects wondering how long it will take to leave my system

Had trimethoprim for a UTI, one a day. The first night I had the most horrible acid reflux all night, woke up the next morning with the sorest throat in the world and about 2 hours sleep. Then after night 2, I experienced a massive headache where I couldn't put my headset on to work and I felt so tired.By night 3 I was a bit itchy on my arms and a rash developed but the UTI had gone by then, so I stopped treatment.If a Dr recommends alprim again I'm going to say no.
I got trimethoprim for a UTI  for 2 days second day I had severe runs  headache sweats  feeling week first time I have tried this medication never again

This is my third time on trimethoprim (Alprim) for a UTI and it  has worked every time, but UTI continues to slowly come back so got told next time I will be put on a low dose of this for 3 months!Never had any noticeable side effects. Recommend to everyone to please take with a good probiotic to minimise side effects, rebuild good gut bacteria and prevent thrush.

I started on a 3 day course of trimethoprim on Monday for a UTI  it gave me severe diarrhoea within a day. Never again I am prone to UTI's I usually get something else called cephalexin  but not this time  so ending up with severe migraine & diarrhoea

Was prescribed a 3 day course of Trimethroprim here in the UK for a UTI ( I have a history of these infections). I managed to complete the course & it does appear to have resolved the infection, but by day 2 I had developed a crippling headache that nothing would shift, so bad it some times hurt just to move my head. Don't know what I would have done if the course had been longer - I advise caution as the headache is deeply unpleasant.

I was on trimethoprim for 7 days taking 1 pill twice a day. From about day 2-3 I was getting nauseous and headaches and felt very ill. I could not go to the toilet and by the morning of day 4 I felt extremely weak and nauseous . However I was able to go to the toilet from day 4 but I had the shakes and was weak. Each night after my second tablet around 6pm I got pain and spasms where my kidney is. Not sure if this is working

I have just finished a week's course of trimethoprim for cystitis. It cleared symptoms within a few days which was great but they made me feel unwell in myself. I felt nauseous all week and also felt achy and lethargic as if I were coming down with another illness. Once I finished the course, the nausea stopped but a day later I woke up to find an itchy rash all over my upper legs - basically an allergic reaction. These antibiotics certainly cleared the infection quickly but I obviously don't tolerate them very well. However, was on them for a week and I think that they can be prescribed for shorter lengths of time.
I have been on this drug trimethoprim several times for UTI's, the Drs always recommend it.Always get dreadful nausea, headache and loss of appetite.
trimethoprim was awful, I was given it for an UTI ! Literally had anxiety for hours. Dry mouth. And cannot settle to sleep. Hate these so I'm not taking.

Im looking on here in the hopes I hear of others experience with almost a numbness  in my right hand ..( weird trying to text ect..) I don't know how to describe it - like  its a bit asleep and shakes if I  try use the fingers individually .If I put both hands on table  flat and raise each finger, left hand is steady ,but right hand fingers shaking. I am on meds 3 days now. I am not going to take them today. I have only noticed this side effect from yesterday and am hoping its the medication ,trying not to go to a dark place that it could be a bigger issue.
I have just returned home from Hospital after Acute Renal failure. I was prescribed 7 tablets, 1 daily for 7 daysI was hospitalized with Acute Renal failure. Outcome reaction to Aspire.

There are better antibiotics with less severe side effects than trimethoprim. I take medication regularly which I've not had side effects for however alprim gave me a headache that got more severe til I was throwing up in my car leaving work and ever so nauseous. The pain was so severe in the temples of my head and cramping all through the base my neck. I couldn't move nor ease it. My jaws were clenched so much I had to put my tongue in between my teeth to alleviate this cramping sensation. Threw up all night til bile was all there was left. I was scared and anxious, no energy.

Tried Trimethprim last year and it made me feel very nauseous. I was hesitant taking them again, however this time I have only had mild nausea, maybe a headache and a sore jaw. I think every experience is different. It cleared up my UTI so I’m happy

Was prescribed trimethoprim for medium grade UTI that Ural & Hiprex couldn’t quite clear. 1 x 300mg for 7 days, 1st day I took two tablets. UTI has NOT gone away & seems to be getting worse again. Feeling fatigued and exhausted on this drug too, also off’ psychologically. This is the 3rd time I’ve taken it, belatedly remember that last time didn’t work too & I went back to a female dr who prescribed another round BUT ALSO wrote a penicillin script in case it still doesn’t clear up, which all UTI prone females know does the job. I ended up ditching the trimethprim & took the penicillin instead, which worked. My opinion as a 37 yr old female: refuse trimethoprim If you’re not allergic to penicillin. It doesn’t seem to be effective in the one 300mg/day dose against UTIs, & the side effects alone on that amount are crappy. I’d rather a dose of thrush & the UTI efficiently gotten rid than the side effects of this drug & the damn UTI STILL NOT cleared up.

I'm on day 3 of this medication and before reading these reviews I have had a migraine that won't go away, shaky hands, trembling, paranoid, dry mouth, nausea and the itchiest skin. These are all of the symptoms I've read of people that have taken this it's actually scary worth reading up before you take something new.

I'm male, 49 years old.  Apparently unusual for men to have UTIWas prescribed on 200mg trimethoprim x 2 tablets for 7 days and within 24 hours symptoms had gone.Unfortunately on day 7 after i had finished course, UTI came back.  on last day of further 7 day course and concerned its not going to shift it.

Curses. Back on this absolutely rotten Alprim but I have no choice. Keflex was OK  for the UTI but it seems the bug likes it and wants to holiday in my bladder. Alprim gives me the worstheadache plus feeling quite sick. Grit the teeth andget on with it. Of course I will. Waiting now for the result of the urine test to make sure Alprim will work. Sorry for the grizzle. I really have nothing to moan about. Love to all.

This antibiotics  trimethoprim is good for treating UTI’s but give awful side effectsHad 3 days worth of these and although cleared up infection came with some unwanted feelings worse side effects were migraine type headaches fatigue shakes nausea and racing heart Absolutely awful wouldn’t want to take these again thank god it was only 3 days!

I was prescribed 5 day course of 300mg trimethoprim for UTI treatment when I walked in at Emergencies (there was blood and total incontinence). Have had the worst days ever: insomnia, massive throbbing headaches, my hands are shaking, and bloating on the face and legs. Feel so tired, depressed and I've been having obsessive-catastrophic thoughts. Is it just me? The blister contains 7 pills, unsure whether to finish or stop at 5, as I don't want the UTI back.

I was given ALPRIM for a bladder infection?? I was told to take in the evening with food, the first night I nearly went mad, I had  nausea, itching, headache, pain in my lower legs and feet and then on day 2 a severe rash appeared and my feet both swelled they were also red raw I thought I must have had gout. Day 3 I took another tablet and the rash spread on both legs the pain was unbearable, moods were hard to live with. I have had infected cellulitis and that was painful but nothing like this so on day 4 the lower legs all blistered and I was in shocking pain so that was the end of Altrim never again and it is 3 weeks later and the legs are slowly coming back to normal still very red so please be aware of this medication and if you notice any changes in yourself stop it I will never take it again.

Have been suffering from UTI 's  continually for 6 years. Going from keflex to alprim.   The infection always comes back. Had alprim before but this time on day 1 huge headache. Day 2 extremely thirsty have the shakes trembling hands and nausea. I really don't want to finish these but will take 3 all up and go.back to doctor.

I was prescribed Trimethoprim three days ago after a being taken off nitrofurantoin due to adverse reaction. I am coping but the fatigue and nausea are the worst side effects of this drug to me.  I have to take these for the next for days and and just hoping they do their job and I can get on with my life. Currently feel exhausted, nauseous, no appetite and just generally grotty. Loth to go back to GP complaining as the last thing I want is yet another antibiotic prescribing with even worse side effects.  Hugs to anyone taking UTI antibiotics as they all seem to come with a lovely list of side effects.
Felt very very tired and lethargic and also a bit depressed with no energy or motivation. Cleared up infection in 3 days and my skin rosacea even cleared up
Would never take trimethoprim again. Made me feel sickly.  Really bad tummy pains be glad to get off them one more to go.

Given 200 mg twice a day for 2 weeks. The UTI cleared up ok, but I had severe anxiety & intrusive thoughts after 2 days. It was one of the worst 2 weeks of my life. I will NEVER take this medication again. (3 days after the 2 week course of medication was completed my thinking returned to normal, and my anxiety disappeared.)

Prescribed trimethoprim for UTI at walk-in clinic 4 days ago (after nearly 4 hours of sitting there). Not aware of any side effects and today the agony has ended. So for me it has worked, for which I am grateful, but certainly not a quick fix. Prescribed 200mg tablets twice a day for 7 days.
Tongue very sore now even taking only for one day

Been on this antibiotic trimethoprim for three days and no side effects. I’m on a longer course of the same drug. I mainly get headaches and nausea from this stuff and a bit of gas too. Been struggling mentally, I’m not sure if that’s related. It’s clearing up the infection well enough though and having to deal with the pain in the butte of UTI symptoms for the past month, that’s good enough for me. I’m currently on day 3 of a 7 day course.

I was prescribed a 3 day course of Alprim, one per night for a urinary tract infection. After taking the first tablet a red blotchy rash appeared on my lower legs, extremely itchy. Next day I noticed blisters had appeared in the rash. I also was extremely tired, and had a burning feeling in my stomach, but as I only had one tablet to go to finish the course I continued to take it as I did not want the urinary tract infection to return. 2 days after completing the course the blistered rash is still with me although the itching has ceased. The UTI has gone, but I will never take this again as I have really suffered, this must be an allergic reaction.

trimethoprim worked fine 2 months ago but got another UTI and was given 3 days of treatment while waiting for hospital culture to be done. trimethoprim makes me very very tired and bad depression and just no appetite.  Only one more day to go so hopefully my appetite will pick up when dose over

I’m on day 6 of this medication  trimethoprim for a UTI and I can’t wait to get off it.  I am waking up all night long, headaches, trembling fingers,  aching bones  it seems to be interacting with my blood pressure tablets  and it’s making me feel on edge.The first day was ok, the second day started having these side effects and as each day passes, I am literally getting worse. In order to take this last tablet tomorrow I have had to stop my blood pressure tablets. My dosage is 300 mg per day. The UTI seems to have gone, but I want to finish the course, scared incase it comes back, I'll have to find some other antibiotic, can’t tolerate this any longer.

Was prescribed 7 days (one a day) script of alprim. 300mg of trimethoprim in it. I got onto my urinary tract infection early so the drug worked wonders within 24 hours but by the third day my anxiety was extremely heightened and I was having panic attacks and usually my anxiety never does that. I couldn’t figure out why I was so on edge, then I realised this script was the only new thing. I have two more days to go and I cannot wait to get off the stuff I feel so anxious and like I’m gonna cry at the drop of a hat.

I had a UTI and was prescribed Alprim (trimethoprim), 300mg one at night. On the third day I developed a severe rash on both lower legs and feet. I have taken it for 5 days and I am not taking the last two. I have taken photos to show my Doctor, definitely seems like an allergic reaction of some type
No side effects, cleared up infection.

Had a UTI that turned into a kidney infection. I get chronic UTI’s and have become resistant to many antibiotics. Day three of 300mg, once a day, and my kidney infection cleared. Woo! I was left with a bladder infection still for the rest of the week. I started taking biofilm defence and the antibiotic started to do its job properly. I’m guessing biofilm is the cause of my chronic UTI’s. Feeling heaps better with this combo. Side effect is that I have extreme fatigue when I take this.
The trimethoprim  medication caused repeated bouts of prolonged nausea and I find myself trembling during my three day course.

Took this medication (trimethoprim) for UTI. Never again. Had a burning sensation in my stomach and awful pains. I was trembling and had the worst headache on day two that lasted all day. Nothing would shift it. By day three I was so fatigued I could barely move. Should have stopped this tablet on day 1

Was prescribed trimethoprim(in UK) 2x200mg for a UTI, within an hour of taking first one, I was suffering from a killer headache, light headedness, nausea and heart palpitations. Wore off after 4 hours, after taking second tablet, I actually passed out! Same symptoms, only multiplied by 10. Had used these tablets before with no side effects and actually wondered it it was more than a UTI. Had restless night, unable to sleep, itchy skin, felt as if there was something crawling underneath my skin. Took third tablet in the morning and oh my god, I was unable to speak, could hardly walk wasn't able to eat, couldn't pee, and my heart was racing. I will never take these tablets again, and strongly advise anyone else to do the same.
trimethoprim suffered no side effects at all and it cleared up the urinary tract infection.

I took this drug for the second time. 24-48 hours later developed an itch which erupted into a huge blister on my penis - is is a kind of allergic reaction called a Fixed Drug Eruption. Was send to Emergency Department. Later consulted  dermatologists who confirmed rare and serious side effects t of this drug.
Trimethoprim just had no beneficial effect on UTI.  Ended up with kidney infection

Got diagnosed with a urine infection and for prescribed Trimethoprim for 3 days, twice a day. The bladder infection stopped after 2/3 antibiotics. Finished the course now and completely back to normal. Didn’t get any serious side effects other than a slight headache on the second day, but didn’t get anything like nausea/anxiety. Overall pleased with the antibiotic and feeling much better now because of it.

It did clear up my UTI on about the second day of taking this however I was prescribed 200mg to be taken twice a day. I would take this and would suddenly get a headache that wouldn’t go for hours even if I took paracetamol, I got really bad nausea to the point I would gag but have to fight to not be sick and would get really bad neck pain, it also made me feel really down on one of the days. I stopped taking it after 4 days and still have 3 pills left however even after stopping on Tuesday morning I sometimes wake up with neck pain and a bit of nausea with a funny taste in my mouth. I would simply AVOID this antibiotic.

Taken for a UTI.  I started having headaches with them and itching then after a few days I was covered in a rash and my face had swollen up found it difficult to swallow.  I had hives all inside my mouth. I had an allergic reaction to the tablet.
Had these prescribed by my GP here in the UK.  This drug certainly cleared the UTI up quickly but had the following side effects: - Sweats and feeling hot then cold, sore throat and extreme fatigue.

Awful medication. Took for 2 1/2 days and had to stop taking. Symptoms:-Acute pain in arms, legs, groin. Difficulty in moving to fingers etc.-Fever-Headache-Red eyes-Rash on leg-Stiff neck-Back pain-unable to sleepTo make matters worse... bladder pain still there. Will never take again!

Prescribed 20 of these to take over a period of 10 days. Half way through, symptoms of UTI have gone BUT I have awful giddiness and nausea with these. After about 6 hours it wears off and I feel great till I swallow the next one. Dizziness means it’s effecting work and head headed / stiff neck. Hope I don’t have to take them again as it makes me feel horrible!

I took three day course. From day 2 bad headache, weariness and aching. Had to sleep on day 3. After stopping, was ill for 2 days with exhaustion, terrible headaches, toothaches, and pain throughout my body. I will never take this dangerous drug again.

After taking two tablets I went into anaphylatic shock, had to call paramedics inject adrenaline and spend 18 hours in Accident and Emergency, just beware of this, I had never taken Trimehtoprim before, dangerous drug.

The urine tract infection is gone after two doses, but at a cost. Feeling nausea, vomiting, itchy rash on ear, slight temperature increase, a terrible headache. I stopped taking  it after the second dose by doctors advice.

I was give 4 days of trimethoprim for a UTI . After the first tablet it brought on intense anxiety and panic attacks and I couldn’t sleep. I stopped it after the second day and it went away. It was awful will never touch it again !!!
Caused extreme depression, anxiety and panic.

Since taking a low dose of this drug, I have had pricking all over my body. It feels kind of like shingles, though it's not.  I am supposed to take for 3 months, but will have to call Dr. to get something different because of this side effect.

I’m on a 3-day course with these tablets for a UTI Since taking them I’ve had the worst throbbing headaches, I’m dehydrated and can’t seem to quench my thirst, I’m exhausted (really fatigued) I have stiff neck and a sore throat. I’ve taken these in the past and never had side effects like this. They have changed somehow

This drug worked very well for me and cleared up my UTI in a matter of 48hrs, although I was on a 7 day course of 2x200mg/daily. Unfortunately once the tablets finished the infection returned so needed a 2nd course. I'm currently taking a low dose at evening to keep the infection at bay while the specialists do some tests.  I normally get every side effect going and dread taking new medication in any form especially after an horrific experience with Ciorofloxacin but the only side effect I experienced with this was itchy ankles and feet on day two but that didn't last into third day so I would class this as a minor side effect and insignificant. Good luck.
caused me severe toothache and jaw ache

I was prescribed Trimethoprim for urinary tract infection and found that I started spotting and had no clue why this was happening . I felt alarmed and tried to find out the reason but later after I got the urine test reports , I found that I did not have any infection and was taking this antibiotics for no reason so I was asked to discontinue the antibiotic . When I stopped the medicine , the spotting stopped. I wanted to share this information as there is no mention of this side effect for this   medicine anywhere.
Was given accidentally a triple dose and I had weird psychological effects, panic and paranoia. I rang poison information and this can happen in too high doses

Cleared up the uti BUT 5 weeks after taking the final tablet I'm still having side effects.  First noticed that I had a sore throat and stiff neck after taking tablets for 5 days ( was given a seven day course) but did not make connection with taking antibiotics. Continued to take medication.  I then developed sensitive scalp, neck pain got worse and on and off headaches plus shoulder/back pain.  Felt awful.  I was on holiday at the time and it seemed to ease after about a week.  Reported to my GP on returning to the UK.  Now 5 weeks later, on holidays again, neck pain, sore skin, head pains are all back. Hope this helps others.  Not sure if I should seek medical attention or just hope problems go with time.
It cleared up my UTI but made me feel extremely nauseated and gave me really bad headaches. I got prescribed it last year though without any side effects so I'm not really sure what that's about.

I was taking 200mg over 3 days. On the second day I got horrendous neck ache, ear ache and a sore throat. I stopped taking it but the symptoms carried on. I'm going back to the doctors today for something else.

I was getting daily migraines on this drug. Half-way through the course I decided to stop taking my daily dose, after a really awful migraine that I needed to take sumatriptan to clear up.Another doctor had prescribed me another antibiotic for UTI earlier in the year. I had no problems then.

I was prescribed trimethoprim by GP, I was a little confused as I was 25 week pregnant at the time. The drug can still be prescribed but during testing was observed to cause some problems????? Needless to say, the drug didn't work. I as usual ended up with thrush from the tablets and when I had a check up a week later I still have the infection. Doctor has prescribed Nitrofurantoin. These pose lesser risk to my baby, but are a lower dose. fingers crossed these will work. I live in the uk
This medication does work rapidly on urinary tract infections but has given me a sore throat.

After several bouts of urinary tract infections while awaiting prolapse surgery - bladder unable to void efficiently - I experienced extremely severe mouth ulcers on each occasion, lasting three weeks. I was told this was probably because I was "run down". However, most recently, half an hour  after taking the first dose of Trimethoprim I experienced intense burning of my lower lip, accompanied by extreme swelling. Recognising this as the start of the severe mouth ulceration I had experienced previously on numerous occasions, I informed my doctor, who immediately prescribed antihistamine and told me to stop taking the Trimethoprim, substituting another antibiotic.
